partintro.para: Umot haOlam is translated as "The People of the World".
Every human being takes an oath in utero to be righteous(Niddah 30b, Iyov). The Umot haOlam have forsaken this oath.
Every human being has 248 bones that desire to do mitzvot(Rambam from Sefer Mitzvot). The Umot haOlam forsake this desire.

Every human being who's spirit moves them, can obtain understanding and with his knowledge set himself different and stand before haShem, to serve and minister to Him and to know haShem, walking straight as Elokim made him, and and can remove the yoke of the thoughts of bnei Adam. This human being is sanctified like the Kadosh Kadoshim. haShem is his portion and heritage forever and will provide what is sufficient for him in this world like He provides for priests and Levites. Thus David, peace be upon him, said
Tehillim 16:5 "haShem is my lot and my portion; You are my cup; you support my lot."
Rambam, Mishneh Torah, Hilchot Shemita v'Yovel 13:13

Every living thing with blood in its body has an animal soul called a nefesh behemut. All nefeshot behemut emanate from some type of klipah depending on what type of nefesh behemut it has. Umot haOlam have animal souls that emanate from three klipot that are impure called klipat tameyut.

Also, all human beings have a Godly soul called a nefesh Elokit. The nefesh Elokit is revealed in the Umot haOlam. It hovers over them and is distant from them as what is called makif rachok.
Ginsburgh, Kabbalah and Meditation for the Nations, page 55-56
